results.name: a(n) = 5^n mod 9.
comment: Also the digital root of 5^n. - _Cino Hilliard_, Dec 31 2004
Digital root of the powers of any number congruent to 5 mod 9. - _Alonso del Arte_, Jan 26 2014
reference: Cecil Balmond, Number 9: The Search for the Sigma Code. Munich, New York: Prestel (1998): 203.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,-1,1).
maple: A070366:=n->power(5,n) mod 9: seq(A070366(n), n=0..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jun 28 2016
program: (MAGMA) [Modexp(5, n, 9): n in [0..100]]; // _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jun 28 2016
xref: Cf. Digital roots of powers of c mod 9: c = 2, A153130; c = 4, A100402; c = 7, A070403; c = 8, A010689.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 12 2002
